CatDescriptText: Miss Nancy Drew, 743 Bower Hill Road, Bridgeville, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should be 'militant' in their fight for civil rights or pursue a course of 'sitting down, talking and seeking a working plan for obtaining them without vigorous pressure?"  Answer reads: "I think that if its possible in any way to obtain it without force, it's all well and good. If not, we will have to resort to militant force."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Nancy Drew, wearing dark button down sweater and round jeweled earrings, standing in front of light colored column with pedestrians and store window with mannequin in background
